result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared M Smerling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the $150.00 cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.

1.  Domestic Abuse assessment and any follow-up recommendations.
2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jared M Smerling
Current: N1931 County Rd XX, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 04-30-2015)
Prior: 113 E Huron St Unit C, Berlin, WI 54923
Defendant's copy of the JOC has been returned.  Return to sender.  Re-sent to: N1931 County Road XX  Berlin, WI  54923
Judgment of conviction has been returned.  Return to sender.  Insufficient Address.  Unable to Forward.  04/23/2015 - Re-sent to:  113 E. Huron St Apt C  Berlin, WI  54923

1:24 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, has reached an agreement, but requests to argue sentencing.  Defendant will proceed.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  DA recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 2 on 2015CM10 and count 1 on 2015CM43, and the other counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2015CM43 and DRI count 2 and guilty on count 2 on 2015CM10 and DRI count 1.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing argument by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  BOTH CASES - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs
Domestic Abuse assessment and any follow-up recommendations.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
2015CM10 - 10 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days and may be served on weekends.

2015CM43 - $150 cash bond be applied to the court costs.

Court adjourned at 1:38 p.m.
No Violent Contact with Kaitlynn G.
No Violent Contact with Kaitlynn G.

1:29 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - requests to talk with the DA.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court will set for status hearing on March 30, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
  

Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $150.00 cash bond and conditions of: No Violent Contact with Kaitlynn G.

Court adjourned at 1:33 p.m.
